DOC.HEAD: Two Arrested in Drive-By Shootings
DOC.TEXT: Two teen-agers were arrested and charged today with the drive-by shootings of two women who police said were innocent victims of a turf battle among drug dealers near a housing project. Eric Reed, 17, and Dwayne Faust, 16, both of the borough of Queens, were charged with murder, assault, weapons violations and reckless endangerment, said Sgt. Tina Mohrmann, a police spokeswoman. They were arrested at 2:10 a.m., nearly 24 hours after they were arrested at the scene of an unrelated shooting, she said. Reed and Faust were accused of killing Lysa Biffle, who was 26 and nine months pregnant, and Ebony Williams, 18, who was planning to attend college next fall, on Christmas night shortly before midnight. Ms. Williams was shot twice in the head as she and a friend were making a call at a pay phone in Queens. Mrs. Biffle and her husband, Dwayne, 25, were shot as they were getting into their car after visiting a relative. She gave birth to a healthy boy by Caesarean section before she died. Biffle was treated for a foot wound. Police say the neighborhood where the shootings occurred has attracted gangs who fire at innocent people to show other drug dealers that they are moving into the area. Reed and Faust were also charged with the attempted murder of 18-year-old Douglas Moore, who was seriously injured in a shooting Friday morning that apparently resulted from an argument in a parking lot, Mohrmann said.
